captions.text:
Mr. Reede, it is out of
sheer morbid curiosity...

l'm allowing this...
freak show to continue.

Mrs. Cole...
if you dare.
Mrs. Cole...

is this a copy
of your driver's license ?

- Yes.
- It says here you're
a blonde. Are you ?

- [ Scoffs ]
- If you don't remember,
perhaps Mr. Falk will.

- Brunette.
- We can play the tape again.
Maybe it's on there.
l'm a brunette !

Thank you.
Now let's see.

''Weight: 105.''
Yeah ! In your bra.

- Your Honor, l obiect !
- You would !

- Bastard !
- Hag !
Quiet ! Overruled ! Weight ?
One-eighteen.

All right, fine, fine.
l'm 127.

Uh-huh. And it says here
you were born in 1964,

but that's not true
either, is it ?

- Is it !
- No.

Will you tell me what it says
here on your birth certificate
under ''date of birth'' ?

Your Honor, what does this
have to do with anything ?

Overruled. Mrs. Cole,
answer the question.
Now let me get this straight.

That would mean that you lied
about your age to make yourself older.

But why would any woman
want to do that ?

l changed it
so l could get married.

And the truth
shall set you free !
My client lied about her age !

She was only 17 when she got married,
which makes her a minor,

and in the great
state of California,

no minor can enter
into any legal contract...

without parental consent,
including--
Prenuptial agreements.

Prenuptial agreements !
This contract is void !

The fact that my client has been ridden
more than Seattle Slew is irrelevant.

Standard Community Property
applies, and she is entitled
to half of the marital assets,
or $11.395 million !

Jordan fades back. Swoosh !
And that's the game !
Nothing further, Your Honor.
[ Applause ]
[ Judge Pounding Gavel ]
Order. Order. Order !
ln light of this new evidence,

the court must rule
in favor of Mrs. Cole.

- Yes !
- She is hereby awarded
half the marital assets.

- [ Screams ]
- The son of a bitch pulled it off !

- l didn't know !
- [ Dana ] It doesn't matter.
The contract's void.

[ Judge Pounding Gavel ]
Order. Order.

title: Liar Liar (9/9) Movie CLIP - And the Truth Shall Set You Free! (1997) HD

comments.text:
En el caso de pelicula LIAR LIAR de Jim Carrey se muestra claramente la 
diferencia entre lo justo y lo correcto, pues al ganar el caso lo justo era 
que su cliente se quedara con la custodia de sus hijos sin embargo no era 
lo correcto porque a su cliente no le interesaban sus hijos.
En este fragmento, se muestra como Jim Carrey nota la diferencia entre 
justo y correcto.﻿
comments.author: Lizbeth Vazquez Bello

comments.text:
La inspectora se ha dirigido de muy buena manera a los empleados, sin 
embargo yo creo que debería de dar alguna seguridad económica al que desee 
hablar y hablar con cada uno de los trabajadores por separados. 

Una actuación justa por parte de la inspectora habría sido el dejarle una 
tarjeta o teléfono para poder comunicarle sus inquietudes en un futuro, y 
una actuación correcta sería el hablar con el director sobre las 
condiciones laborales de sus trabajadores.

SI existe una gran diferencia en actuar justo y actuar correcto y para 
validar mi opinión tengo un claro ejemplo: 

 Lo justo es pagar salario mínimo a tus empleados, sin embargo lo correcto 
sería pagar en proporción al trabajo/ tiempo realizado. No es lo mismo 
pagarle el salario mínimo a una persona que trabaja medio turno repartiendo 
volantes, que pagarle salario mínimo a una persona que trabaja tiempo 
completo cargado material pesado. 

Por otra parte, según un reporte hecho por la Secretaria de Desarrollo 
Económico, en las últimas cuatro décadas el salario mínimo de nuestra 
capital, DF, ha perdido 77% de su valor, pasando de 225 pesos diarios en el 
año 1976 a tan sólo 67.29 pesos en 2014. 

El reporte también señaló que en los últimos diez años, México es el único 
país de América Latina que no ha registrado un crecimiento en materia de 
salarios mínimos. (Universia, 2014) 

México tiene una justicia para los ricos y esto no se puede denominar como 
correcto. 
Si la justicia existe, tiene que ser para todos; nadie puede quedar 
excluido, de lo contrario ya no sería justícia. (Paul Auster).

Regarding Common Law Marriage: She was living with him before she turned 
the legal age. Both must be 18 at the time they begin living together and

by law considered to be married. The key here is that she had to be 18 
years old which she was not. Again, she gets nothing!﻿

comments.text:
+Jewish Tsade Is There Common Law Marriage in California?

It is a commonly held belief that if a couple lives together for a number 
of years without getting married, they are considered common law married 
even if they don't intend on getting married and present themselves as a 
married couple. However, there is no common law marriage recognized in the 
state of California.
There is no common law marriage recognized in the state of California.
- See more at: 
http://www.cadivorce.com/california-divorce-guide/planning-for-a-california-divorce/is-there-common-law-marriage-in-california/#sthash.cMCFSaZP.dpuf

comments.author: tajniak4

comments.text:
This scene is wrong from a legal perspective. The fact that she was 17 
doesn't make the pre-nup void.

When she turned 18 she would have had 2 years (under California law) to 
avoid the marriage and the pre-nup. But after 2 years both the marriage and 
the pre-nup would be considered ratified and enforceable. So this fact 
would not win the case for her.﻿

comments.author: Julia Johnson

comments.text:
Yep. The husband would have a slam-dunk case for annulment since she 
fraudulent entered into a contract that was designed to protect his estate. 
But the pre-nup wouldn't be void anyway. California law places a two year 
time limit on when a minor can void a contract they entered into before 
coming of age. So if she signed the pre-nup at 17 it would have been 
considered ratified and enforceable after she turned 20.
comments.author: aseriousman91

comments.text:
Marriage at 16, legal. Also, even if it wasn't allowed at 16, she would of 
had to of had consent from a parent/guardian, and one of those would 
probably of been a witness to the wedding, granting acceptance of the 
martial contract. Whammy.
comments.author: Chris Barnes

comments.text:
That would depend on when the actual marriage licence was filed. If her 
birthday passed, she would have been able to legally marry, yet the 
prenuptial agreement, which filed before her birthday would be void.

comments.author: 5StarFilmz

comments.text:
It's not justice. In fact, that's actually the point of this scene: 
Fletcher's job requires him to hurt people, and he never understood that 
until he managed to find a way to hurt someone while being completely 
honest. He won because of technicality. It was stupid, it was a miscarriage 
of justice, it was manipulating the legal system...which fits the plot 
perfectly, since it causes the newly-honest Fletcher to realize how lousy 
his job really is and how little value making "partner" would be.
comments.author: MartialArtsMaster

comments.text:
Normally it would be, but the problem is that Mr. and Mrs. Cole have been 
living together for over a decade anyway, which means their marriage is now 
classified under "common law marriage" statutes. Which is a stupid way to 
resolve the trial...and that's the WHOLE POINT. It was supposed to be 
stupid; it's meant to hammer home how much harm Fletcher can do in the 
course of his job by manipulating the legal system, which Fletcher now 
finds horrifying since he now knows what being honest is like.
comments.author: MartialArtsMaster
